member.summary: Gets or sets the managed client id.
member.remarks: If you have the external access add-on installed in your TSheets account, you can make API requests using your auth token against clients that you manage. When you want to make an API request against one of the clients that you manage, you must include this property value. To obtain the id's of clients you managed, call the GetManagedClients() data service method.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RequestOptions.AutoPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether auto paging behavior is enabled or disabled. (enabled by default)
member.remarks: The TSheets API returns a maximum of 50 items per call. If AutoPaging is enabled, follow-up calls to retrieve the additional pages will automatically be made in the event that retrieval call results in more than 50 items. If disabled, additional pages will need to be retrieved manually (using , while the 'More' property of is true.)

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings
member.summary: Controls retry behavior, intended for use with transient network faults.
member.remarks:
The number of seconds between retries is given by the formula: i^e * m where i = iteration (aka retry number), e = exponent, m = multiplier.
Exponential back-off example: Given MaxRetryCount = 3, Exponent = 2, and Multiplier = 1 Retries will occur at 1, 4, and 9 seconds after each successive attempt (up to max of 3 retries).
Linear retry example: Given MaxRetryCount = 3, Exponent = 0, and Multiplier = 5 Retries will occur at 5 seconds after each attempt (up to max of 3 retries).

member.name: M:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Type[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The maximum number of times to retry.
For exponential back-off, the power to which the retry iteration will be raised.
Value to multiply for linear scaling of the time between retries.
The Exception types to retry when encountered.

member.name: M:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.None
member.summary: Gets the static instance used to disable retries.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.MaxRetryCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of times to retry.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.Exponent
member.summary: Gets the power to which the retry iteration will be raised (for exponential back-off).

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.Multiplier
member.summary: Gets the rate at which to linearly stretch or compress the time between retries.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Api.RetrySettings.RetryTypes
member.summary: Gets the enumerable of Exception types to retry when encountered.

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Client.Serialization.Converters.EmptyArrayObjectConverter
member.summary:
This converter is a workaround for a bug in the TSheets API responses. Specifically, some properties will contain an empty JSON *array* to indicate no results found, when in actuality the response should be an empty *object*. This specialized converter simply ignores the unexpected empty arrays, and falls back to default conversion in the expected object case. Without it, serialization would fail with message "Cannot deserialize the current JSON array".
As an example, see the "GET Files" operation:
When empty: "linked_objects": [],
When not empty: "linked_objects": { "timesheets": [ "55912018", "55913268" ] }

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Client.Serialization.Converters.SerializationConverter
member.summary: A custom converter for controlling whether properties of entities are to be serialized.
member.example:
The "Id" property of any given entity is set by the TSheets API at the time the entity is created. Since we don't want this property to be included in serialized POST requests (but we *DO* want it included on PUT requests), it should be marked with the [NoSerializeOnCreate] attribute, and this class should be instantiated by passing "typeof(NoSerializeOnCreate)" into the constructor as a "noSerializeType".
Likewise, the "CreatedData" property is never to be serialized (whether a POST/PUT). This property is therefore attributed with [NoSerializeOnWrite].

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The types used to indicate properties must not be serialized.

member.remarks: Only objects decorated with the [DataEntity] attribute can be converted.
member.param: Type of the object.
member.returns: true if this instance can convert the specified object type; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.CustomField.CustomFieldType
member.summary: Gets the type of custom field.
member.remarks: See for allowable values. If 'FreeFor', then it should be displayed in a UI as a text box, where users can enter values for this custom field and they'll get added automatically to the custom field if they don't already exist. If 'ManagedList', then it should be displayed as a select-box and users can only choose an existing value.

member.summary: Gets the preferred user interface type.
member.remarks: See for allowable values.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.CustomField.RegexFilter
member.summary: Gets the regular expression to be applied.
member.remarks: Expression is applied to any new items as they're added to the custom field. If they do not match the regex filter, they will not be added.

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Model.CustomFieldItem
member.summary: A Custom Field Item represents an allowable value for a Custom Field Object of managed-list type. Each item represents a single drop-down choice displayed to the user in the web UI. The API provides methods to Create, Read, and Update custom field items. Set the active property false to archive (i.e. soft delete) a custom field item.

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Model.EffectiveSettings
member.summary: All combined, cascaded settings that apply to a given user are contained in the effective settings object. The effective settings object consists of a series of sections. Each section contains a settings and a last modified property. The settings property is a list of key/value pairs, and the last modified property gets updated any time a key/value pair within a section has changed.

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode
member.summary: Jobcode. Anything you're tracking time against is considered a job code and includes customers, job sites, work orders, projects, and tasks.

member.name: M:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with minimal required parameters to create the new entity.
member.param: Name associated with this jobcode.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.Id
member.summary: Gets the id of jobcode.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.ParentId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the parent of this jobcode.
member.remarks: Value is 0 if jobcode is top-level.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the jobcode.
member.remarks: Cannot be more than 64 characters and must be unique for all jobcodes that share the same .

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.ShortCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the abbreviated alias for the jobcode.
member.remarks: A shortened code or alias that consists only of letters and numbers. Must be unique for all jobcodes that share the same . If the Dial-in Add-on is installed, this field may only consist of number since it is used for jobcode selection from touch-tone phones.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.JobcodeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the jobcode.
member.remarks: See for allowable values. Additional types may be added in the future. 'PTO' type jobcodes are used for PTO (Paid Time Off, i.e. Vacation, Holiday) time entries. They are only allowed with a of 0 (i.e. top-level). 'PaidBreak' and 'UnpaidBreak' type jobcodes are used in conjunction with the Breaks Add-On. These types of jobcodes may not be created/edited via the API. They are managed via the Breaks Add-On on the web.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.Billable
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether or not this jobcode is billable.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.BillableRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the billing rate associated with this jobcode.
member.remarks: Only effective if billable is true.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.HasChildren
member.summary: Gets the value indicating whether or not this jobcode contains child jobcodes.
member.remarks: If true, there are jobcodes that exist underneath this one, so this jobcode should be treated as a container or folder with children jobcodes underneath it.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.AssignedToAll
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether or not this jobcode is assigned to all employees.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.RequiredCustomFields
member.summary: Gets the ids of custom fields that should be displayed when this jobcode is selected on a timesheet.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.FilteredCustomFieldItems
member.summary: Gets the custom field items that are to be displayed when this jobcode is chosen for a timesheet.
member.remarks: Each property of the object is a id with its value being an array of id. If none, an empty string is returned.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the jobcode.
member.remarks: If true, this jobcode is active. If false, this jobcode is archived. To archive a jobcode, set this field to false. When a jobcode is archived, any children underneath the jobcode are archived as well. When you archive a jobcode, any jobcode assignments or custom field dependencies are removed. To restore a jobcode, set this field to true. When a jobcode is restored, any parents of that jobcode are also restored.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Jobcode.LastModified
member.summary: Gets the date/time when this jobcode was last modified.

member.summary: Gets the date/time when this jobcode was created.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Notification.Id
member.summary: Gets the id of the notification.

member.summary: Gets or sets the id for the user that this notification will be sent to.

member.summary: Gets the GUID string used for additional tracking.

member.summary: Gets or sets the message text of the notification.
member.remarks: The maximum message length is 2000 characters.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Notification.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the transport method of the notification.
member.remarks: See for allowable values. The 'Push' method utilizes the TSheets mobile app to deliver the notification to a mobile device. The 'Email' method sends an Email to the user (if they have an Email address). The 'Dashboard' method utilizes the TSheets web dashboard notification queue to deliver a notification to the user. They will only see this when they're logged in to the TSheets web app.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Notification.Precheck
member.summary: Gets or sets the pre-check macro name.
member.remarks: See for allowable values. The 'OnTheClock' macro will first check if the recipient is on the clock before sending and if not, will discard the notification. The 'OffTheClock' macro will first check if the recipient is off the clock (and not on PTO) before sending and if not, will discard the notification. The 'None' macro (the default) will not perform any checks before sending.

member.remarks: Defaults to the current time.

member.name: T:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder
member.summary: Reminder, for pushing Clock-In and Clock-Out reminder notifications to employees of your company.

member.name: M:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.#ctor(System.Int32,Intuit.TSheets.Model.Enums.ReminderTypes,System.DateTimeOffset,Intuit.TSheets.Model.Enums.DaysOfTheWeek,Intuit.TSheets.Model.Enums.ReminderDistributionMethods,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with minimal required parameters to create the new entity.
member.param: Id of the user that this reminder pertains to. A value of 0 indicates that this is a company-wide reminder.
The type of this reminder object.
The 24-hour time that the reminder should be sent. The time should be in even 5 minute increments. For example: '13:45:00' or '08:00:00'.
The comma-separated list of the days of the week when the reminder should be sent. For example: 'Mon,Tue,Wed,Thu,Fri' or 'Tue,Sat'.
The comma-separated list of the transport method(s) indicating how the reminder message should be sent.

The status of the reminder. If true, this reminder is active and will be evaluated at the and . If false, this reminder is inactive and will not be evaluated. If false for user-specific reminders, then the company-wide reminder of the same reminder type will apply.

The value indicating whether or not the reminder is enabled. If true, the reminder is enabled and will be sent at the and . If false, the reminder is disabled and will not be sent. A user with an active but disabled reminder will not receive that reminder type regardless of how company-wide reminders are configured.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.Id
member.summary: Gets id of the reminder.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.UserId
member.summary: Gets id of the user that this reminder pertains to.
member.remarks: A value of 0 indicates that this is a company-wide reminder.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of this reminder object.
member.remarks: See for allowable values.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.DueTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the 24-hour time that the reminder should be sent.
member.remarks: The time should be in even 5 minute increments. For example: '13:45:00' or '08:00:00'.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.DueDaysOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the comma-separated list of the days of the week when the reminder should be sent.
member.remarks: See for allowable values. For example: 'Mon,Tue,Wed,Thu,Fri' or 'Tue,Sat'.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.DistributionMethods
member.summary: Gets or sets the comma-separated list of the transport method(s) indicating how the reminder message should be sent.
member.remarks: See for allowable values. The 'Push' method utilizes the TSheets mobile app to deliver the notification to a mobile device.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the reminder.
member.remarks: If true, this reminder is active and will be evaluated at the and . If false, this reminder is inactive and will not be evaluated. If false for user-specific reminders, then the company-wide reminder of the same reminder type will apply.

member.name: P:Intuit.TSheets.Model.Reminder.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether or not the reminder is enabled.
member.remarks: If true, the reminder is enabled and will be sent at the and . If false, the reminder is disabled and will not be sent. A user with an active but disabled reminder will not receive that reminder type regardless of how company-wide reminders are configured.
